args.natural_language_statement:
Let f : R^n ‚Üí R be differentiable at x0. Show that ||‚àá f(x0)|| = sup { |Df(x0) h| : ||h|| = 1 }.
Translate into Lean4 (Mathlib) statement ending with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open RCLike Real Filter

/-- Let f : R^n ‚Üí R be differentiable at x0. Show that ||‚àá f(x0)|| = sup { |Df(x0) h| : ||h|| = 1 }. -/
theorem gradient_norm_eq_sup_filter_dual_extending {n : ‚Ñï} [RCLike ùïú] [NormedAddCommGroup E]
    [InnerProductSpace ùïú E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E] [NormedAddCommGroup G] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù G]
    {f : E ‚Üí G} {x‚ÇÄ : E} (h : DifferentiableAt ùïú f x‚ÇÄ) :
    ‚Äñh.toLinearMap‚Äñ = Filter.dual.sup (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) fun x => DifferentiableAt

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let f : R^n ‚Üí R be differentiable at x0. The norm of the gradient at x0 equals the
operator norm of the derivative, i.e. the supremum of |Df(x0) h| over unit vectors h. -/
theorem gradient_norm_eq_sup {n : ‚Ñï} (f : (Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù) ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù}
  (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  ‚Äñ‚àá f x0‚Äñ = Sup ({ |(fderiv ‚Ñù f x0) h| | h : Fin n ‚Üí ‚Ñù, ‚Äñh‚Äñ = 1 } : Set ‚Ñù) := by sorry
